Property Law.question: The following except one are circumstances warranting the need for a power of attorney:

options.a: Where the expertise of the donee is required
options.c: Where a mortgage is created by subdemise under the Conveyancing Act
options.d: Where a mortgage is created by subdemise under the PCL .

Property Law.answer: Where a mortgage is created by subdemise under the PCL .
Property Law.reason: Where a mortgage is created by Sub-demise under PCL states, there is no need to insert any remedial devices like power of attorney or trust Declaration to protect the mortgagee in the event of default by the mortgagor.

Property Law.question: Exchange of contract gives to the Purchaser one of the following titles:
Property Law.reason: One of the legal effects of Exchange of contract at the contract stage is that the purchaser acquires equitable title in the property. Legal title is still with the vendor. The legal title will only pass when a deed of assignment is executed at the Completion stage.

Property Law.question: The key feature that distinguishes a deed of lease from other deeds is the presence of:
Property Law.reason: Reddendum is the rent clause which is only found in a deed of lease.

Property Law.question: One of the following is not an essential element of a valid lease:
Property Law.reason: Rent is not an essential requirement for the validity of a lease. A lease agreement can be valid notwithstanding the fact that the lessee pays no rent.

Property Law.question: Which of these is not a way of creating an equitable mortgage?

options.a: Agreement to create a legal mortgage
options.b: Creation of an imperfect legal mortgage
options.c: Creation of mortgage with equitable interest

Property Law.reason: Creation of mortgage by sub-demise is a way of creating legal mortgage applicable in all the jurisdictions.

Property Law.question: Where a mortgagee has two or more mortgages on different properties with the same Mortgagor, the mortgagee may refuse to permit the mortgagor to redeem one without the other(s) through the doctrine of:
Property Law.reason: Consolidation is the right the mortgagee of two or more mortgages on different property with the same mortgagor has to refuse to permit the mortgagor to redeem one without redeeming the others. This clause must be expressely stated and agreed to.

Property Law.question: In a legal mortgage created by deed, the power to appoint a receiver:

options.b: Must be expressly provided in the deed
options.c: Is subject to approval by the court
options.d: Must be subject to the consent of the Governor.

Property Law.reason: In a legal mortgage, the power to appoint a receiver is implied; it need not be expressly provided in the Deed of legal mortgage. However, in an equitable mortgage, the power of appointment must be expressly stated in the Deed.

Property Law.question: Legal services such as searches at the Land Registry and the Corporate Affairs Commission can be charged under what scale of the Bill of Charges?
Property Law.reason: There are limited circumstances where a lawyer may charge under scale I (sales, purchases and mortgages) and scale II (Leases). The circumstances where a lawyer may charge using scale III are not limited, but the transaction must not be a contentious one. Thus searches at the land registry and CAC may be charged under scale III.

Property Law.question: A will is ambulatory because:

options.a: It speaks from the death of the testator
options.b: It is revocable at any time before the death of the testator
options.d: It distributes the testator’s estate upon his death.

Property Law.answer: It is revocable at any time before the death of the testator
Property Law.reason: To say something is ambulatory means that it only becomes binding after the testator is no longer alive thus a testator can always change or even revoke the will before his death.

Property Law.question: The authority for the principle that a blind man can make a Will is:
Property Law.reason: John Intsiful v. Henry Charles Christian Kofi Ampah WACA 81994

Property Law.question: Which of the following documents is not needed in processing an application for probate by the executors?

options.d: Letter of authority of the family members

Property Law.answer: Letter of authority of the family members
Property Law.reason: The Will is the letter of authority for the executors to act. There is no requirement of a separate letter of authority by the family of a deceased before the executors can apply for probate.

Property Law.question: All but one of the following are features of an Assent:

options.b: It is used to transfer title in movable properties of the deceased

Property Law.reason: An Assent does not need to be by Deed.

Property Law.question: The circumstances in which the executors of a deceased estate would be entitled to remuneration do not include:

options.a: By the consent of the beneficiaries
options.b: By an order of the Court
options.c: The rule in Cradock v Piper

Property Law.answer: By the consent of the beneficiaries
Property Law.reason: The Beneficiaries consenting to remunerate the executor is not binding. There has to be an express provision, or an order of court or follow the rule in Cradock v Piper 1850

Property Law.question: NOW THIS DEED WITNESSES AS FOLLOWS is the usual beginning of what part of a deed?
Property Law.reason: Testatum is not a part of a deed. There are four parts of a deed:introductory, operative,miscellaneous and concluding parts. Testatum is Under the operative part.

Property Law.question: The Power of Attorney granted to a person to “let premises to tenants and collect rent” is?
Property Law.reason: A power donated is to complete specific things thus, its a specific POA

Property Law.question: The stages of contract of sale of land in Nigeria do not include:
Property Law.reason: They are five stages of a contract of sale. Pre-Contract, Contract, Post-Contract, Completion and Post-Completion stage

Property Law.question: The factors to be considered when fixing rent do not include:

options.d: State and condition of the property

Property Law.reason: The economic status of the tenant is usually immaterial when considering the amount to charge as rent on a property.

Property Law.question: The apex mortgage institution in Nigeria is?
Property Law.reason: The Federal Mortgage Bank of Nigeria is the apex mortgage institution in Nigeria because it regulates and supervises the mortgage industry.

Property Law.question: A solicitor acting for both the lessor and lessee in a lease transaction shall be entitled to his professional fee as follows:

options.a: Full payment from the lessee and half payment from the lessor
options.b: Full payment from the lessor and half of the lessees fee
options.c: Full payment from the lessor and quarter of lessors fee from the lessee

Property Law.reason: In leases, the lessors solicitor is entitled to the full charges as computed according to the scale, while the lessees solicitor is entitled to half of what the lessors solicitor is entitled to. Where a solicitor acts for both parties, he will be entitled to full charges from the lessor plus half of what is due to the lessees solicitor or quarter of lessors fee.

Property Law.question: The legal age approved under the Wills Act for a person to make a Will is?
Property Law.reason: Sec.24 Wills Act
